properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:24PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

White Lick Creek...
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams in Indiana...

Mill Creek near Cataract
Youngs Creek at Amity

.With the continuance of rain this weekend, area waterways continue
to rise.  The gages near Cataract on Mill Creek and Amity on Youngs
Creek are now expected to crest tonight near the moderate flood
stage marks.  Significant flooding will be the result, affecting
local roads, parks, and agricultural land.

As of mid-afternoon Saturday, White Lick Creek in Mooresville was at
its banks.  Flooding is, or soon will, be underway.  Flooding is
expected to mostly affect agricultural land.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Youngs Creek at Amity.
* until further notice.
* At 3:15 PM Saturday the stage was 9.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 7.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will continue rising to near 10.2 feet by this
evening and will rise later to 10.3 by this evening then begin
falling to 9.8 feet Sunday morning.
* At 10.0 feet...Significant flooding in progress.  Parks and some
local roads are flooded by a foot or more of water.  Agricultural
flooding is noticeable.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity
